title: Complete Guide to Writing Marketing Plans
headline: This free online course will teach you more about writing an effective marketing plan to grow your business.
description: The Complete Guide to Writing Marketing Plans is a free online course offering a strategic roadmap to organize, execute, and track businesses. You will learn how to write an effective marketing plan, create the foundation for growth and success, and understand how to identify your Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats (SWOT). The course will better equip you to organize ideas and create a good business plan to grow your business.

courseDescription:
Every business owner expects to reach and convert their target market. And many of these business owners start their ventures with marketing as an afterthought, only to quickly discover that marketing is one of the most critical parts of a business plan. The Complete Guide to Writing Marketing Plans is a free online course that teaches you how to create and plan effective marketing campaigns. You will better understand the importance of a marketing campaign and learn how to write each section. This includes learning how to write details about the company or business, its mission statement and what it has to offer. You will learn how to plan your business to stay organized and get more customers. You will also get a better idea of first-time mistakes that entrepreneurs/marketers can avoid. 

The course evaluates how to create a branding strategy to suit your business type. You will learn how to write a competitive analysis and how to organize your ideas. This will enable you to create a good plan of action for promoting your business before starting your company so that you can plan ahead. This course will enable you to manage your time better to research which strategies will work for your business to get clients. The types of companies that will benefit from this course include local businesses like flower shops, restaurants and phone repairs. If you’re planning or running an affiliate business, you’ll also benefit by learning how to write a marketing plan for a blog, new products, or websites.

Finally, the course will introduce you to different avenues of marketing. Stop wasting time randomly posting on Facebook, Twitter, and stop struggling with business cards or passing out flyers. Instead, learn how to build a foundation for growth and success. The course covers various elements, from basic strategy to grow your YouTube channels to selling on e-commerce platforms. You’ll also benefit from this course if you’re operating in the Business to Business (B2B) sector. This course will be of immense benefit to marketing professionals, Entrepreneurs, Small business owners struggling with marketing, and people planning a business. Start your learning journey today.

Start Course Now

All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:

  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.

Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module introduces you to writing each section of a marketing plan. It teaches you tips on how to write a correct marketing plan. You will learn how to plan your business so as to stay organized and get more customers.
topics: Sections of a Marketing Plan - Learning Outcomes
Sections of a Marketing Plan - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module introduces how to identify your Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats. In this module, you will learn about budgeting and resourcing. This module explains how to identify your ideal customer avatar. Marketing strategy and customer retention strategy will be explained. You will learn how to set and achieve financial goals.
topics: S.W.O.T Analysis and Business Strategy - Learning Outcomes
Identifying Customer Avatar and Branding Strategy
S.W.O.T Analysis and Business Strategy - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about marketing plan templates. The marketing plan templates, company, and strategy overview will be explained. You will learn how to plan an e-commerce product. This module teaches you about local business, affiliate business, platforms, and big websites.
topics: Marketing Plan Templates: Case Study - Learning Outcomes
Marketing Plan Templates: Case Study - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module gives you a practical walkthrough of a business plan for an actual successful business. It explains the approach towards three elements of a business plan. This module teaches the basic strategy on how to grow your youtube channels for a more growing audience. It analyzes the vital parts of a business plan.
topics: Real Examples: Marketing Plan Creation - Learning Outcomes
Strategy of Growing a YouTube Channel
Real Examples: Marketing Plan Creation - Lesson Summary

topics: Complete Guide to Writing Marketing Plans - Course Assessment

• Learning Outcomes

    • Analyze a few first-time entrepreneur/marketer mistakes.
    • Explain the criteria for writing a good marketing plan for your business.
    • Outline the importance of a marketing plan.
    • Explain what makes a good mission statement.
    • Outline the necessities of Unique Value Proposition, UVP.
    • Explain how to rightly choose the demographics and psychographics of your target customers. 
    • Identify the criteria to consider before choosing your market demographics.

  • Lesson Summary
    • A marketing plan is either a stand-alone document or a part of your business plan which focuses o your business strategy in other to effectively promote your business
    • Common mistakes of a marketing plan include are: not having a marketing plan at all, and choosing everyone as your target audience.
    • The strategy outlined in a marketing plan is what makes a good marketing plan.
    • It is important to have a marketing plan as it will enable you to catch problems easier and faster.
    • Without a plan; business will chaotic, not enough research of what will be effective, mistakes are common since you are deciding on a fly.
    • Contents of a business plan include Executive Summary, Company Description, business details, mission statement, Service /Product Line, and free content.
    • A unique value proposition (UVP) is the core benefit or solution that differentiates your product or service from the competition and positions it as the best possible option on the market.
    • Demographic analysis is the study of a population based on factors such as age, race, marital status, religion, and sex.
    • Psychographics analysis is the study of a population-based on factors such as personality, characteristics, lifestyle, Social class, attitudes, principles & beliefs, activities & Interests.
  • Learning Outcomes
  • Upon the successful completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • Evaluates how to create the branding strategy to suit your business type.
    • State how to write a good competitive analysis.
    • Explain how to identify your customer avatar.
    • Outline the details of marketing initiatives and budgeting.
    • Describe how to maximize business referrals and also your Key Performance Indicator.
    • Discuss customer retention strategy.
    • State how to create cost and marketing spending projections.

  • Lesson Summary
    • SWOT is the acronym for analyzing Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats, and is an effective tool for developing an overall marketing strategy, or for planning individual campaigns.
    • A key component to marketing and strategic planning is conducting a SWOT analysis.
    • In order to build a customer avatar, you need to:
       - Identify their Goals and Values.
       - Find their Sources of Information.
       - Fill in their Demographic Info (and NAME them)
       - Identify Challenges & Pain Points.
       - List out their Objections & Role in the Purchase Process.
    • Marketing strategy is a process that can allow an organization to concentrate its limited resources on the greatest opportunities to increase sales and achieve sustainable competitive advantage.
    • Customer retention is the collection of activities a business uses to increase the number of repeat customers and to increase the profitability of each existing customer.
    • Referral marketing is a marketing tactic that makes use of recommendations and word of mouth to grow a business's customer base through the networks of its existing customers.
    • Break-even analysis entails calculating and examining the margin of safety for an entity based on the revenues collected and associated costs.
  • Learning Outcomes
  • Upon the successful completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • Outline the requirement for creating and planning an e-commerce product.
    • Explain the differences between SEO and local SEO.
    • Describe how to write a marketing plan for local businesses.
    • Discuss how to write a marketing plan for platforms and big websites.
    • Identify the process of writing a marketing plan for a self-branded business.
    • Explain the importance of creating a marketing plan for an affiliate business.

  • Lesson Summary
    • A strategy includes your company's goals and objectives, the type of products/services that you plan to build, the customers to whom you want to sell, and the markets that you serve to make profits.
    • A business strategy is the means by which an organization sets out to achieve its desired objectives.
    • SEO stands for Search Engine Optimization.
    • Important factors to consider when writing a marketing plan for agencies include Local Business Networking, Differentiation,  Local SEO.
    • Affiliate marketing is making money by selling the products you haven't created.
    • When creating a marketing plan for an affiliate business, the first factor to be considered is SEO.
    • A personal branding strategy is a plan to take your reputation and career from relative obscurity to high visibility.
    • The most important part of marketing for big websites is platform SEO. 
    • The anatomy of a 2-sentence marketing plan include: Differentiation, Correctly choose a marketing strategy, UVP.
    • The most important part of the marketing plan is the quality of the strategies that you choose for your business.
  • Learning Outcomes
  • Upon the successful completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • Discuss the strategies on how to grow your YouTube channel.
    • State the basic approaches to Search Engine Optimization, SEO.
    • Analyze how to run a budget for your business for a profitable business scheme.
    • Explain the strategy of running a business-to-business company.
    • State how to write a marketing plan for a Business to Business company.
    • Explain the vital parts of a marketing plan.

  • Lesson Summary
    • A "high-level overview" is one that doesn't cover details. It provides a very basic and general explanation or presentation of the material/subject.
    • Branding is the process of communicating a unique selling proposition, or differential, that sets a product or service apart from the competition.
    • Methods of growing YouTube channels are: 
      - Find Untapped Video Keywords
      - Use Thumbnails That Stand Out
      - Optimize Your YouTube Videos.
    • EO works by optimizing your site for the search engine that you want to rank for, whether it's Google, Bing, Amazon, or YouTube.
    • In some countries, marketing expenses are tax-deductible.
    • Business-to-business refers to a business that is conducted between companies, rather than between a company and individual consumer..
    • Quality products creates unshakeable customer loyalty that generates increased leads.
